hints.content: Start by understanding what an anagram is. An anagram is a rearrangement of the letters of a word or phrase to create a new word or phrase. In this case, you're looking for the positions of elements from one list in another list.
Consider how you can map the elements of the first list to their indices. You might want to create a dictionary where the keys are the elements and the values are their indices.
Think about how you can iterate through the second list and use your dictionary to find the corresponding indices from the first list. This will help you create the mapping.
Remember that the order of elements matters when you're creating the output list. Make sure to preserve the order of the second list when you generate the final output.
Consider edge cases, such as when the lists are empty. What should your function return in that case? Always ensure your solution can handle these scenarios gracefully.
What if the two lists contain duplicate elements? Ensure that your mapping logic can handle such cases correctly. Each element's index should correspond to its first occurrence.
You can use a list comprehension to create the output list. This can make your code cleaner and more readable. Think about how you can leverage this feature in Python.
Make sure to test your solution with various inputs, including lists of different lengths and values. This will help you ensure that your solution is robust.
Before finalizing your solution, consider the time complexity of your approach. Aim for an efficient solution, ideally O(n), where n is the length of the input lists.

Your final output should be a list of indices that correspond to the positions of the elements of the first list as they appear in the second list. Think about how you can structure this output correctly.

questionNotes: Both input lists are guaranteed to have the same length.
Elements in the lists can be unique or duplicated.
The output should be a list of indices, not the values themselves.
Consider the case where the input lists are empty.
